newsitem.title: CANADA: Output unaffected by fire at Vitol Canada refinery.
newsitem.headline: Output unaffected by fire at Vitol Canada refinery.

text.p: A fire on Sunday that damaged a storage tank at the Come by Chance refinery in Newfoundland was not affecting production, refinery manager Ed Mills said on Wednesday.
The cause of the fire at the 105,000-barrel-a-day Vitol-owned plant was unknown and still under investigation Mills said.

An explosion in an empty 150,000 barrel tank ruptured the roof but did no further damage, he said. No further environmental cleanup was required and repair costs were expected to be several thousands of dollars, Mills said.
The refinery, which runs mostly trans-Atlantic crude oil, is operated by Vitol unit North Atlantic Refining Ltd. ((Reuters Calgary Bureau (403) 531-1624))
